trans-unit.source: Implements a structure that is used to describe the <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of an object.
<xref:System.Windows.Size> is particularly useful because it describes both the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> of an object.
<xref:System.Windows.Size> is used extensively by the layout system to arrange and measure elements.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*width*
A value greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Size> structure.
*height*
A value greater than or equal to 0 that specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Size> structure.
Initializes a new instance of the structure and assigns it an initial width and height.
The `width` and `height` cannot be negative.
The initial width of the instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
The initial height of the instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
Gets a value that represents a static empty <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> of the instance of <xref:System.Windows.Size> are equal to negative-infinity when this property is invoked.
This is the only situation where <xref:System.Windows.Size> can be a negative number.
An empty instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
Compares an object to an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> for equality.
<xref:System.Double> values can result in an error when operated upon.
Values that are logically equal might fail to result in a value of `true`.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the sizes are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Compares a value to an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> for equality.
<xref:System.Double> values can result in an error when operated upon.
Values that are logically equal might fail to result in a value of `true`.
The size to compare to this current instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
`true` if the instances of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> for equality.
<xref:System.Double> values can result in an error when operated upon.
Values that are logically equal might fail to result in a value of `true`.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the instances of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the hash code for this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
The hash code for this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Size.Height"></xref> of this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size.Height"></xref> of this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
The default is 0.
The value cannot be negative.
Gets a value that indicates whether this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> is <xref href="System.Windows.Size.Empty"></xref>.
Even if <xref:System.Windows.Size> is 0, the instance of <xref:System.Windows.Size> will still contain a 0 or 1, indicating a zero- or one-dimensional set of points.
Therefore, do not use this property to check for a 0 area.
`true` if this instance of size is <xref href="System.Windows.Size.Empty"></xref>; otherwise `false`.
Compares two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> for equality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> to compare.
true if the two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> are equal; otherwise `false`.
Compares two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> for inequality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> to compare.
`true` if the instances of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> are not equal; otherwise `false`.
Returns an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> from a converted <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> value to parse to a <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> value.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents this <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> object.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> property is set to 30 and the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> property is set to 40, the <xref:System.Windows.Size.ToString%2A> method returns a string that says `"30, 40"`.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the width followed by the height.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
An object that provides a way to control formatting.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents this <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Size.Width"></xref> of this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size.Width"></xref> of this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
The default value is 0.
The value cannot be negative.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The format to use.
The provider to use to format the value.
The value of the current instance in the specified format.
